enableExternalScriptLoadQuestion_descrip.message: Do you want to get a question by USI to import a Userscript? (When calling Userscript sources whose URL end is `user.js`)

required_script_one_include.message:
You must set at least -one- include expression -> 

 @include *website.com*

required_script_name.message:
You should set a name for your script, it is not necessary to be unique -> 

 @name my_userscript

found_bad_encoding.message: a false character was found, perhaps through an false encoding, please try to use another encoding

empty_userscript_url.message: You have to specify a URL where your Userscript can be found, otherwise you can not go on.

should_usi_import_this_userscript.message: Should USI load and activate this UserScript?

overview_description.message:
The options are now seperated, 
if you want to see your Userscipts go to "all Userscripts"

userscript_was_saved.message: The userscript was saved and is now activated!

options_always_activate_greasemonkey_des.message: If Greasemonkey functions are always activated, you don't need '// @use-greasemonkey true' in your userscript to use functions like GM_getValue() ...

alternative_charset_description.message: If you have problems with the encoding of files, you can specify here another encoding

OldUsiIncludeBehavior_description.message: You can change the behavior of processing the include rules, to the old way of USI, otherwise the behavior of Greasemonkey should be used.

changelog_2.message: Since USI version 0.4.1-a-alpha and above, new userscripts will be active after the tab was reloaded (if the include rule will match this tab)

userscript_was_modified_by_usi___reason_.message: Your Userscript was modified by USI, it has added an @name <Filename>!

confirm_delete_all_GMValues.message: You delete all defined GM Values in this Userscript, are you sure?

help_1_title.message: Why doesn't the Userscript work, which was written for Greasemonkey?

help_1_description.message:
In many cases, the Userscript won't run directly in USI, bacause USI and GM are handling the @run-at statement slightly different 
 often it is enough to switch this, that means if the GM Userscript has "@run-at document-start" defined, then you have to switch it to "@run-at document-ready" for USI

help_2_title.message: Why did I not have access to the "document"?

help_2_description.message:
Like in the other case, the reason is the "@run-at" statement, 
 if it is defined as "document-start", there is no complete "document" at the time your Userscript runs, this will be available with "document-ready". 
 For futher informations take a look at this page 
"page-mod" (https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/Add-ons/SDK/High-Level_APIs/page-mod) in the chapter "contentScriptWhen"

config_add_css_description.message: Here you can enter your own CSS to change the configuration interface of USI

config_add_css_reset_question.message:
Reset all CSS settings? 
(OK) => reset | (Cancel) => keep
